newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals called to open lower.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals called to open lower.

text.p: COMEX and NYMEX precious metals futures were expected to open lower Friday, with palladium called limit down and sharp losses seen in platinum as well, dealers said.

The white metals continued to fall overnight because of the weaker yen and an announcement earlier in the week that the long-delayed shipments of Russian PGM exports for this year would begin soon, traders said.
COMEX June gold was called $1.00 to $1.50 below Thursday's close of $343.20 an ounce.
COMEX July silver was called 1.0 to 2.0 cents lower.
Gold's sentiment was dampened overnight by the sharp falls the platinum group.
June gold traded $343.40 to $342.10 on ACCESS, and early bullion was quoted by dealers at $341.20/60.
Gold was fixed at $341.65 in London this morning, slightly down from Thursday afternoon's fix of $342.75.
July silver traded $4.69 to $4.64 on ACCESS.
COMEX gold stocks Thursday were down 18,628 ounces at 873,763 ounces, while COMEX silver stocks fell 455,248 ounces to 195,585,128 ounces.
NYMEX July platinum was called $3.00 to $5.00 lower from Thursday's close of $389.00.
NYMEX June palladium was called to open down its $6.00 limit after settling Thursday at $175.35.
Precious metals trading in New York finishes early Friday with palladium ending at 1300 EDT, silver at 1305, and platinum and gold at 1310.
NYMEX and its COMEX division are shut Monday for Memorial Day. London precious metals trading will also be closed Monday due to a U.K. public holiday.
